 ESG performance – high ratings received by the most important rating agencies and supplier platforms; DPDHL Group is among the top 4% of evaluated companies. The company has set an ambitious target: Reduce GHG emissions to net zero by 2050. Material topics: Energy efficiency and climate change, air pollution. Management system: Implement environmental standards across the Group and create a uniform framework for a ‘green’ thinking and action (based on ISO standards). Renewable energy: Renewable energy is the primary source of electricity across the Group. Programs and partnerships support the UN Sustainable Development Goals. Low hanging fruits already picked, further improvements become more difficult. Use clean technologies: Substitute remaining energy demand with clean fuel alternatives such as electricity, hydrogen or synthetic fuels. Picking up momentum as technologies evolve. Shares of renewable energy use and ISO certified sites further increased. ~2bn climate neutral products offsetting projects.

 assistant
We have an ambitious new set of targets for reducing our impact on the environment, with aggressive timelines. We're also encouraging suppliers and industry peers to take bold steps, as only through working together can we make sustainable living commonplace.

We're improving the health of the planet by reducing our carbon footprint and advocating for 1.5 °C-compatible depth in our reduction measures. We've also adopted new packaging targets and are working to reduce plastic pollution.

Our net zero emissions target covers our entire value chain, from sourcing to point of sale. We're building on our progress to date and expanding our influence to involve more suppliers and consumers.
